docs.lead_paragraph: Jay Leno According to the latest poll, if George Bush ran for president today he would lose to the Democratic candidate. President Bush said, ''Again?'' This is an interesting survey. Fifty-four percent of lawyers said they would not represent a terrorist. The other 46 percent said they would represent them, but only as a professional courtesy.
docs.snippet: Jay Leno, Conan O'Brien and Borowitzreport.com share their thoughts on President Bush, the avian flu and other news of the week.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: The picture of Dr. Bernard Kaminetsky's waiting room showing snacks of cake and bagels captures a fundamental problem of medical care, including concierge doctors: inadequate attention to prevention.
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     The picture of Dr. Bernard Kaminetsky's waiting room showing snacks of cake and bagels captures a fundamental problem of medical care, including concierge doctors: inadequate attention to prevention.

headline.main: H.I.V. Drugs Not at Fault For Causing Gain in Girth

docs.lead_paragraph: The new class of drugs called protease inhibitors revolutionized the care of H.I.V. patients in 1996. But many people who took the drugs began to lose fat tissue in their cheeks, arms, legs and buttocks. Many also developed a paunch -- nicknamed ''Crix belly'' after Crixivan, one protease inhibitor -- and they gained weight in their upper trunks.
docs.snippet: A new study has found that weight gain in people who took H.I.V drugs called protease inhibitors was associated with age.

headline.main: Tie Between Obesity and Dementia Is Discovered

docs.lead_paragraph: A study in Finland has found that being overweight at midlife is associated with an increased risk of dementia. The researchers examined the records of 1,449 men and women randomly selected from participants in four other large health studies when they were 51 on average and then examined the participants 21 years later.
docs.snippet: A study in Finland has found that being overweight at midlife is associated with an increased risk of dementia.     The researchers examined the records of 1,449 men and women randomly selected from participants in four other large health studies...
